subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Grammar question: Demonstrative vs. nondemonstrative "that"
msgSnippet: Probably because the relative pronoun never bears the stress. On Mon, Apr 23, 2018 at 1:52 PM, gpdiqhfx45cwvckybgkazrwe22guir3me33fnyth@yahoo.com
messageBody:
Probably because the relative pronoun never bears the stress.

On Mon, Apr 23, 2018 at 1:52 PM, gpdiqhfx45cwvckybgkazrwe22guir3me33fnyth@... [Read_Alphabet] <Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com> wrote:


The NON-demonstrative "that" is the relative pronoun as in this sentence:  "The dog that bit the cat got scratched".  As for why he would distinguish them...I'm not sure.  Disambiguation would seem to be the only reason to do so, but context always tells us which "that" it is in real life.  So, who knows?
